cz.ive.simulation
Class SchedulerImpl

java.lang.Object
  cz.ive.simulation.SchedulerImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Scheduler
public class SchedulerImpl
extends java.lang.Object
implements Scheduler

Takes care of real/simulation time conversion, shifting the calendar and passing control to gui. It is implemented as a singleton which holds the main simulation thread for most of the system running time. The simulation is then driven from another thread by asynchronous calls. Only methods whose ability for asynchronous call is documented should be called from another thread, or the system can fail. There is also a synchronous mode of run which needs only one thread, but has almost no control over the simulation.

Author:
pavel

getSchedulingState

public SchedulingState getSchedulingState()
Gets the scheduling state, that can be stored and loaded later. This method is to be called asynchronously from another thread.

Returns:
Current scheduling state
See Also:
setSchedulingState(SchedulingState schedulingState)

setSchedulingState

public void setSchedulingState(SchedulingState schedulingState)
                        throws SimulationRunningException
Sets the scheduling state of the loaded simulation. The state of the rest of the world (mainly the Calendar singleton) have to be loaded before. The simulation must not run when setting the state, or the SimulationRunningException will be thrown.

Parameters:
schedulingState - The loaded state
Throws:
SimulationRunningException

simulate

protected void simulate(long millis)
Runs the simulation till the end or the asynchronous stop, but maximally for the given time.

Parameters:
millis - Number of real milliseconds to the simulation interrupt, no timeout if set to zero, one-round simulation when set to -1.

setTimeRatio

public void setTimeRatio(double ratio)
Specifies the speed of the simulation. This method can be called both in synchronous and asynchronous mode. However, it takes effect at next frame.

Specified by:
setTimeRatio in interface Scheduler
Parameters:
ratio - Number of real milliseconds per one simulation millisecond

runSimulation

public void runSimulation()
Runs the simulation till the end or the stopSimulation() call. This method is to be called asynchronously from another thread and has no effect if the simulation runs synchronously. The execute() method has to be called before.

execute

public void execute()
Gives the main simulation thread to the scheduler. The thread then loops inside and the simulation can be controlled asynchronously from another thread by runSimulation(), stopSimulation(), or setTimeRatio.

Specified by:
execute in interface Scheduler

execute

public void execute(boolean synchronous)
Gives the main simulation thread to the scheduler. This function is rather for developing issues and later will be deprecated. If the argument is set to false, it is a synonym tu execute(): the thread loops inside and the simulation can be controlled asynchronously from another thread by runSimulation(), stopSimulation(), or setTimeRatio. If the argument is set to true, it runs the simulation synchronous. That means there is no other thread to control the simulation, so it will be automatically run and after it's end it will return. If the simulation is running this way, asynchronous methods have no effect (runSimulation(), stopSimulation(), quit()).

Specified by:
execute in interface Scheduler
Parameters:
synchronous - Determines the mode of the simulation

quit

public void quit()
Quits the system - causes the call of execute() method to finish. This method is to be called asynchronously from another thread and has no effect if the simulation runs synchronously.

Specified by:
quit in interface Scheduler
See Also:
execute(boolean synchronous)

isInSimulationLoop

public boolean isInSimulationLoop()
Checks whether the simulation is physically in the simulation loop. This helps to the gui thread wait for the physical jump from the simulation loop after it called the stopSimulation.

Returns:
true if the simulation is in progress; false if the simulation is physically stopped

lockSimulation

public void lockSimulation()
Locks the simualtion thread. This locking should be used with caution and for only a small amout of time, since it prevents scheduler from maintaining proper time sharing between Gui and Simulation. Acquiring this lock ensures, that the simulation is in a consistent state.

Specified by:
lockSimulation in interface Scheduler

unlockSimulation

public void unlockSimulation()
Unlocks the simualtion thread. This locking should be used with caution and for only a small amout of time, since it prevents scheduler from maintaining proper time sharing between Gui and Simulation. Acquiring this lock ensures, that the simulation is in a consistent state.

Specified by:
unlockSimulation in interface Scheduler

Description copied from interface: Scheduler
Updates the world. Locks the simulation, updates the world, unlocks the simulation and calls gui to repaint the world.

updateWorld in interface Scheduler

getTimeSpentByComputing

public long getTimeSpentByComputing()
Description copied from interface: Scheduler
Gets time spent by computing of the simulation in milliseconds. The time is measured since the scheduler creation or since last clearTimeSpentByComputing() call. This is to be used for performance evaluations.

Specified by:
getTimeSpentByComputing in interface Scheduler
Returns:

Returns:

setFastSimulation

public void setFastSimulation(boolean fast)
Description copied from interface: Scheduler
Sets fast simulation state. This method is to be called asynchronously from another thread.

Specified by:
setFastSimulation in interface Scheduler
Parameters:
fast - The new state - if true, the simulation will run as fast as possible. If false, the simulation will run according to the current time ration position.
